content.text:
# Battle of Soldatskaya

Kabardia (East Circassia)
| combatant2        =  Russian Empire
| commander1        =  Zhambolat Princes Kantemir Basaev Roslambek Batokov
| commander2        = Unknown
| strength1         = ~1,000 horsemen
| strength2         = Unknown
| casualties1       = Unknown
| casualties2       = Heavy; the stanitsa destroyed, many civilians killed or taken
}}
Battle of Soldatskaya or Raid on Soldatskaya Stanitsa was a significant episode during the Russo-Circassian War, highlighting the fierce resistance of the Circassian (Kabardian) people against Russian imperial expansion in the North Caucasus.
History
In the early 1825s, a Kabardian force of around 1,000 horsemen, led by Prince Zhambolat, Kantemir Basaev, and Roslambek Batokov, launched a raid on the Russian Cossack settlement of Soldatskaya Stanitsa. The attack resulted in the destruction of the stanitsa and the capture of civilians.
